intro: Galium × timbalii, commonly known as the hybrid wood sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Galium × timbalii thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas and along stream banks. Its growth habit and floral structure make it a distinctive species within the Galium genus.
